{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2015}} {{Use British English|date=July 2015}} {{Infobox government agency | agency_name = Scottish Housing Regulator | agency_type = [[Non-ministerial government department]] | seal = | logo = scottishhousingregulator.png | logo_width = | logo_caption = | formed = {{Start date|2011}} | jurisdiction = [[Scotland]] | headquarters = Buchanan House, 58 Port Dundas Road Glasgow G4 0HF | employees = 47 | budget = £3.8 million (2017-2018) | minister1_name = [[Kevin Stewart (Scottish politician)|Kevin Stewart]] | minister1_pfo = [[Minister for Local Government and Housing]] | chief1_name = George Walker | chief1_position = Chair | chief2_name = Michael Cameron | chief2_position = Chief Executive | chief3_name = | chief3_position = | chief4_name = | chief4_position = | chief5_name = | chief5_position = | chief6_name = | chief6_position = | chief7_name = | chief7_position = | chief8_name = | chief8_position = | chief9_name = | chief9_position = | parent_department = | website = {{URL|https://www.scottishhousingregulator.gov.uk}} }} The '''Scottish Housing Regulator''' (SHR) is an independent [[Non-Ministerial Department of the Scottish Government|Non-Ministerial Department]], directly accountable to the [[Scottish Parliament]]. The body was established on 1 April 2011 under the [[Housing (Scotland) Act 2010]].{{cite web |url=http://www.scottishhousingregulator.gov.uk/about-shr |title=About SHR |publisher=Scottish Housing Regulator |accessdate=21 October 2014 }} SHR is the successor to the previous Scottish Housing Regulator agency, which exercised [[Scottish Ministers]]' powers under the [[Housing (Scotland) Act 2001]]. The statutory objective of SHR is to: *
"safeguard and promote the interests of current and future tenants of social landlords, people who are or may become homeless, and people who use housing services provided by [[Registered Social Landlord]]s (RSLs) and local authorities"
SHR regulates social landlords to protect the interests of people who receive services from them. SHR does this by assessing and reporting on; how social landlords are performing their housing services, RSLs’ financial well-being and RSLs' standards of governance and where necessary SHR will intervene to secure improvements. SHR also keeps a Register of all the RSLs in Scotland. The register holds information about each landlord including their contact details and their regulation plans. In June 2015 SHR won two awards for its IT systems in recognition of its efforts to make information available to tenants to allow them to hold their landlords to account.[https://www.publictechnology.net/articles/news/aberdeenshire-scoops-top-ict-awards] ==See also== *[[Homelessness in Scotland]] *[[Housing and Regeneration Directorate]] *[[Local government of Scotland]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|https://www.scottishhousingregulator.gov.uk}} {{Non-ministerial departments of the Scottish Government}} [[Category:2011 establishments in Scotland]] [[Category:Organisations based in Glasgow]] [[Category:Housing in Scotland]] [[Category:Homelessness in Scotland]] [[Category:Local government in Scotland]] [[Category:Regulators of Scotland|Housing]] [[Category:Non-ministerial departments of the Scottish Government]] [[Category:Public housing in Scotland]] [[Category:Social programs]] {{Scotland-gov-stub}}

{{refimprove|date=May 2012}}{{Infobox War Faction |name=Security Battalions
Τάγματα Ασφαλείας |war= the [[Axis occupation of Greece]] |image=[[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 101I-178-1536-18A, Griechenland, griechische Soldaten.jpg|250px]] |caption=Men of the Security Battalions resting during an anti-partisan sweep in 1943. They are wearing the service uniform of the pre-war ''[[Evzones]]'' regiments. |active=1943–1944 |ideology=[[Anti-communism]],
[[Fascism]],
[[Germanophilia]] |leaders= [[Ioannis Rallis]]
[[Ioannis Plytzanopoulos]] |strength= 22,000 (1944) |headquarters=[[Athens]] |area= |partof=[[Hellenic State (1941–44)]] |groups= |next= |allies=[[Wehrmacht]], [[Schutzstaffel|SS]], [[SiPo]], [[National Union of Greece]], [[Hellenic Gendarmerie]], [[City Police (Greece)|City Police]], [[Organization X]], [[Poulos Verband]] |opponents=[[National Liberation Front (Greece)|EAM/ELAS]], [[Communist Party of Greece|KKE]], [[EDES]], [[National and Social Liberation|EKKA]], [[Panhellenic Union of Fighting Youths|PEAN]], [[National Organization of Crete|EOK]], [[Greek government-in-exile]], [[Special Operations Executive]] |battles= }} The '''Security Battalions''' ({{lang-el|Τάγματα Ασφαλείας|Tagmata Asfaleias}}, derisively known as ''Germanotsoliades'' (Γερμανοτσολιάδες) or ''Tagmatasfalites'' (Ταγματασφαλίτες) were Greek [[collaborationist]] military groups, formed during the [[Axis occupation of Greece during World War II]] in order to support the German occupation troops. == History == [[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 101I-179-1552-13, Griechenland, erhängter Mann in Ortschaft.jpg|thumb|200px|A member of the Security Battalions stands near an executed man.]] [[File:Meligalas cemetery 1.jpg|thumb|200px|Local cemetery in [[Meligalas]] for members of the Security Battalions executed by [[Greek People's Liberation Army]].]] The Battalions were founded in 1943 by the [[quisling]] [[Hellenic State (1941–44)|government]] of [[Ioannis Rallis]].{{Citation | title=Greek Resistance 1941-45 : Organization, Achievements and Contributions to Allied War Efforts Against the Axis Powers | first1=Peter D. | last1=Chimbos | work= International Journal of Comparative Sociology | publisher=Brill | year=1999 | url=http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/brill/ijcs/1999/00000040/f0040001/art00014 | quote=Rallis and the Nazis organized the Greek Security Battalions (Tagmata Asfalias) to counter the EAM/ELAS forces (Hondros, 1983:81 ) which were becoming the most powerful and effective resistance organizations. |volume=40}} They were supported by the [[Far-right politics|extreme right]] and Nazi sympathisers, but also by some centrist politicians who were concerned about the dominance of [[Greek People's Liberation Army|ELAS]] (the military arm of the communist-dominated National Liberation Front [[National Liberation Front (Greece)|EAM]]) as the main body of the Greek resistance{{citation needed|date=January 2015}}. Among the members of the Security Battalions one could find ex-army officers, forcefully conscripted soldiers, conservatives, landowners, extreme-right radicals and social outcasts, as well as opportunists who believed the [[Axis powers of World War II|Axis]] would win the war.{{Citation | title=Greek Resistance 1941-45 : Organization, Achievements and Contributions to Allied War Efforts Against the Axis Powers | first1=Peter D. | last1=Chimbos | work= International Journal of Comparative Sociology | publisher=Brill | year=1999 | url=http://www.ingentaconnect.com/content/brill/ijcs/1999/00000040/f0040001/art00014 | quote=Who were those Greeks who joined the Security Battalions and took an oath to obey the orders of Hitler? They were ex-officers and enlisted men of the Greek army, as well as civilians, with right wing leanings who were sympathetic to the Nazis. |volume=40}} The core of the Battalions consisted of men of the Royal Guard ([[Evzones]], so the name ''tsoliádes''). The main role of the Security Battalions was to fight against ELAS. Their aggregate force was at most 22,000 men, divided into 9 '[[Evzones|evzonic]]' and 22 'voluntary' battalions, under the command of [[Schutzstaffel|SS]] [[Lieutenant-General]] [[Walter Schimana]]. Although the plan was to expand them all over the occupied Greek territories, their main theater of action was in eastern [[Central Greece]] and [[Peloponnese]]. At that time, ELAS had already gained control over 1/3 of continental Greece. They remained faithful to the Germans even when the occupation was crumbling. Their last mission was to engage in combat against ELAS and keep them away from the main routes, in order to secure the safe exit of the German troops from Greece. What the Greek people hated about the Battalions, even more than their collaborationist nature, was the total lack of control over their members. For example after a battle in the hamlet of Attali in Evvia the collaborationists pillaged the houses of the village, taking away 1,000 oka of oil, five sewing machines, 200 ok of cheese and 30 complete trousseaus. 60 mules were needed to carry away the loot. By the end of the occupation their name was synonymous with arbitrary violence and frightful cruelty.Mazower, Inside Hitler's Greece, quoted in Dionysis Charitopoulos, Άρης ο αρχηγός των ατάκτων (=Ares, Leader of the Irregulars) (Athens, Topos, 2009), p. 545 (back-translated by contributor). During the war, the Allied-oriented [[Greek government in exile|government in exile]] and the main resistance organizations in Greece decried the Security Battalions for [[treason]] multiple times. On the eve of the liberation, several battles took place between the Battalions and ELAS; the best known being the [[Battle of Meligalas]] in September 1944. After the liberation, the groups were only temporarily disbanded, and were recruited into the [[Greek Gendarmerie|Gendarmerie]] to fight alongside the British and government forces against the [[National Liberation Front (Greece)|EAM]]/[[Greek People's Liberation Army|ELAS]] in the battle of [[Dekemvriana]], in Athens. In total, very few of their members were tried and convicted of [[collaborationism]]. For instance, their creator and quisling Prime Minister of Greece, Rallis, was sentenced to life imprisonment for treason and died in prison in 1946, but he was acquitted for his involvement with the Security Battalions. After the defeat of the [[National Liberation Front (Greece)|EAM]] in Dekemvriana, the members continued to hunt down left, communist and anti-royalist civilians during the [[White Terror (Greece)|white terror]] period that ensued after the [[Varkiza Agreement]] that dismantled [[Greek People's Liberation Army|ELAS]]. Many ex-members continued carrying out atrocities against the [[Dimokratikos Stratos Elladas|DSE]] during the [[Greek Civil War]]. After the Civil War, and during the persecution of the communists during the 1950s and '60s in Greece, many of the brutal military personnel of the [[Makronisos|exile islands]] accused of tortures were ex-members of the security Battalions. Finally, the leader of the [[Greek military junta of 1967–74|Greek junta]] of the 1970s, [[Georgios Papadopoulos]] had also been accused of being a member of the Security Battalions, but without definite proof.{{cite journal| first=Λεωνίδας | last=Καλλιβρετάκης | journal=Αρχειοτάξιο | title=Γεώργιος Παπαδόπουλος, Τάγματα Ασφαλείας και "Χ": Μια απόπειρα συγκέντρωσης και επανεκτίμησης του παλαιότερου και νεότερου τεκμηριωτικού υλικού | date=2006 | publisher=Θεμέλιο | volume=8 | pages=109–147 | url=http://helios-eie.ekt.gr/EIE/handle/10442/8762 | access-date=27 Dec 2016}} Some members of the Security Battalions were recognized during the [[Greek military junta of 1967-74]] by law as "resistance fighters against the Axis", but this decision was cancelled after the fall of the regime. ==Oath== According to uncertain references, recruits to the Security battalion were under the following oath: {{quote|I swear by God this sacred oath, that I will obey absolutely the orders of the Supreme Commander of the German Army, Adolf Hitler. I will with loyal dedication perform my duties and obey without condition the orders of my superiors. I fully acknowledge that any objection to the obligations hereby accepted will lead to my punishment by the German Military Authorities.{{citation needed|date=March 2013}}}} However, it is reported{{By whom|date2016|date=December 2016}} that Rallis in the negotiations for the founding of such militia unit on the side of the Nazi occupation forces, refused to accept this oath as "Greek military forces can't put their legions to a foreign government"{{quotew|date=2016}}{{vague|2016|date=December 2016}} It is unknown whether Rallis' views were taken into account by German officials. ==Members== *[[Dionysios Papadongonas]], was killed later during the ''[[Dekemvriana]]'' *[[Georgios Poulos]] *[[Leonidas Vrettakos]] *[[Xenophon Giosmas]], after years he took part in the conspiracy for the assassination of [[Grigoris Lambrakis]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==Sources== * {{cite book |title=Inside Hitler's Greece: The Experience of Occupation, 1941-44 |author=Mark Mazower |year=1995 |location=United States |publisher=Yale University Press |isbn=0-300-08923-6 }} * Vasileios Stavrogiannopoulos, ''Η Ζωή της Κατοχής και τα Τάγματα Ασφαλείας'' * Nikolaos D. Christodoulou, ''Pro-Axis Security Battalions in Southern Greece, 1943-1944'' * Antonio J. Munoz, ''Herakles & the Swastika: Greek Volunteers in the German Army, Police & SS, 1943-1945'' * {{cite book |title=Έλληνες εναντίον Ελλήνων |author= Stratos N. Dordanas|year=2005|location=Greece |publisher=Epikentro |isbn=978-960-6647-31-4}} ==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20120614054908/http://forum.axishistory.com/viewtopic.php?f=51&t=90180&start=0 Axis History Forum.com: The Greek Volunteer Battalions] {{Greece during World War II|state=collapsed}} {{National Socialism in Greece}} [[Category:Greek collaborators with Nazi Germany|*]] [[Category:Fascism in Greece]] [[Category:Axis occupation of Greece]] [[Category:Government paramilitary forces]] [[Category:Paramilitary organizations based in Greece]] [[Category:Military history of Greece during World War II]] [[Category:Military units and formations disestablished in 1944]] [[Category:1943 establishments in Greece]] [[Category:1944 disestablishments in Greece]] [[Category:Anti-communism in Greece]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2016}} {{Infobox news event |title = Death of Khaled el-Atrash |date = 13 January 2007 |location = [[Meitar]], Israel |accused = Shai Dromi |charges = [[Manslaughter]] |verdict = Not guilty |}} '''Shai Dromi''' ({{lang-he|שי דרומי}}), born 1959, is an [[Israel]]i farmer who, in an act of [[self-defense]], shot and killed a intruder and wounded another on 13 January 2007 at 3 am after discovering his dog had been poisoned, allegedly by four intruders.{{cite web |last= Fendel|first= Hillel|title=Saga Ends: Shai Dromi Acquitted of Manslaughter |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/132407 |date= 15 July 2009 |work= |publisher= Israel National News|accessdate=15 July 2009}} On 15 July 2009, he was acquitted of [[manslaughter]] but convicted on charges of illegal possession of weapons. The rifle he had used belonged to his father and not registered in Dromi's name. Dromi's farm is near [[Meitar]] in southern [[Israel]], an area plagued by property theft. In the months leading up to the incident, several other dogs had been killed and a tractor and horse stolen. Dromi testified at his trial:
“I awoke at 3 AM to the barking of the guard dog that I acquired after my dogs were poisoned. Even though I was incredibly tired, I got out of bed and walked around the house. After I went back to bed, I again heard the dog barking irregularly. I went out with my weapon and didn’t see anything. I kept walking around [the perimeter of my] sheep pen, and noticed large metal wire-cutters. I panicked. I realized there were men around me."{{fact|date=December 2015}}
When police arrived, Dromi was administering [[first aid]] to the intruder, a [[Bedouin]], Khaled el-Atrash, who later died. Dromi was arrested and imprisoned for a month and later restrained from returning to his farm afterwards requiring volunteers to continue its maintenance. A public uproar drew much attention to Dromi's plight and a law was proposed by [[Knesset|Member of Knesset]] [[Yisrael Katz (politician born 1955)|Yisrael Katz]] and later passed by a large majority in the Knesset. The law, commonly known as the 'Dromi Law', considers opposition to intruders as self-defence and modified the criminal law to allow repelling intruders from a house or agricultural facility if they had a criminal intent.{{cite web |last= Stoil|first=Rebecca Anna|title=New law allows shooting at burglars |url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel/Article.aspx?id=105405 |date= 24 June 2008 |work= |publisher=The Jerusalem Post|accessdate=5 December 2010}}{{cite|url=http://www.knesset.gov.il/Laws/Data/BillKnesset/208/208.pdf|title=A bid to classify defense against intruders as self-defence (Changes to the penal code 2008,section 99)|work=[[knesset]]|language=hebrew}}{{cite| url=http://www.knesset.gov.il/Laws/Data/law/2161/2161.pdf|title=Changes to the penal code 2008,section 98|work=[[knesset]]|language=hebrew}} Section 99 defined any criminal intrusion into a house as life-threatening, and classified that one does not need to retreat but section 98 defined that the law does not apply if one caused the intruders to enter the house. == See also == * [[Castle doctrine]] * [[Death of Yoshihiro Hattori]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dromi, Shai}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Israeli farmers]] [[Category:Self-defense]] [[Category:Defensive gun use]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Israel]]

{{Expand Spanish|Partido Encuentro Social|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox Political party | colorcode = {{Social Encounter Party/meta/color}} | name = Social Encounter Party | native_name = Partido Encuentro Social | logo = PES logo (Mexico).svg | logo_size = 200px | president = [[Hugo Eric Flores Cervantes]] | foundation = 30 October 2006 (regional)
9 July 2014 (national) | dissolution = 3 September 2018 | headquarters = [[Mexico City]] | merged = [[Morena (political party)|Morena]] | ideology = [[Conservatism in North America#Mexico|Conservatism]]{{cite news|work=Animal Político|first=Majo|last=Siscar|url=http://www.animalpolitico.com/2014/07/partido-encuentro-social-favor-de-las-familias-tradicionales-y-contra-el-aborto/|accessdate=2016-02-10|date=2014-07-15|title=Partido Encuentro Social, a favor de las familias tradicionales y contra el aborto}}
[[Social conservatism]]{{cite web|last=Garcia|first=David Alire|date=15 December 2017|access-date=30 May 2018|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mexico-election-amlo/mexico-presidential-race-roiled-as-leftist-front-runner-embraces-right-wing-party-idUSKBN1EA00L|title=Mexico presidential race roiled as leftist front-runner embraces right wing party|publisher=Reuters}}
[[Christian right#Latin America|Christian right]] | position = [[Right-wing politics|Right-wing]] | international = | seats1_title = [[Chamber of Deputies (Mexico)|Chamber of Deputies]] | seats1 = {{Composition bar|30|500|hex={{Social Encounter Party/meta/color}}}} | seats2_title = [[Senate (Mexico)|Senate]] | seats2 = {{Composition bar|5|128|hex={{Social Encounter Party/meta/color}}}} | seats3_title = [[List of current state governors in Mexico|Governorships]] | seats3 = {{Composition bar|1|32|hex={{Social Encounter Party/meta/color}}}} | colors = {{Color box|{{Social Encounter Party/meta/color}}|border=darkgrey}} [[Indigo]] | website = {{URL|http://encuentro.social/}} | country = Mexico }} '''Social Encounter Party''' ({{lang-es|Partido Encuentro Social}}, '''PES''') was a [[Mexico|Mexican]] [[Conservatism|conservative]] political party established on the national level in 2014{{cite web|title=Resolution INE/CG106/2014|url=http://www.ine.mx/archivos3/portal/historico/recursos/IFE-v2/DS/DS-CG/DS-SesionesCG/CG-acuerdos/2014/Julio/CGex201406-14_02/CGex201407-14_ap_2.pdf|website=INE|accessdate=3 February 2015}} and dissolved in 2018. It is part of the coalition ''[[Juntos Haremos Historia]]'' with the [[National Regeneration Movement]] and Mexico's [[Labor Party (Mexico)|Labor Party]] for the [[Mexican general election, 2018|2018 Mexican election]]. ==History== The Social Encounter Party was founded in 2006 by Dr. [[Hugo Eric Flores Cervantes]], a pastor of a [[Neo-Pentecostal]] church that supported [[Felipe Calderón]] in the [[Mexican general election, 2006|2006 presidential election]].{{cite news|work=Animal Político|first=Rubén|last=Águilar|url=http://www.animalpolitico.com/blogueros-lo-que-quiso-decir/2014/09/09/partido-encuentro-social-pes/|date=2014-09-09|accessdate=2016-01-09|title=Partido Encuentro Social (PES)}} It had previously been a "national political grouping", which does not receive public funding.{{cite news|first=Arturo|last=Condado|date=2014-07-10|accessdate=2016-01-09|work=CNN México|url=http://mexico.cnn.com/nacional/2014/07/10/hay-3-nuevos-partidos-politicos-en-mexico-pero-quienes-son|title=Hay 3 nuevos partidos políticos en México, ¿pero quiénes son?}} The party made many of its early successes in the state of [[Baja California]]. In 2007, it supported the successful candidacy of [[José Guadalupe Osuna Millán]] of the [[National Action Party (Mexico)|PAN]], but in 2013, it allied with the [[Partido Revolucionario Institucional|PRI]] in Baja California instead, which led it to elect a state deputy to a district in [[Tecate]] and four council members in [[Tijuana]].{{cite news|work=SDP Noticias|date=2014-07-14|accessdate=2016-01-09|url=http://www.sdpnoticias.com/gay/2014/07/16/nuevo-partido-encuentro-social-luchara-contra-matrimonio-gay|title=Nuevo "Partido Encuentro Social" luchará contra matrimonio gay}} In July 2014, it obtained federal registry. After doing so, eight of its nine political assemblies were nullified, as bribes were given to attendees. The party is primarily composed of evangelical Christians, though it has declared itself as "not religious" in character. ===2015 Mexican legislative elections=== The [[Mexican legislative election, 2015|2015 legislative elections]] was the first election where PES participated at a federal level. It managed to obtain eight proportional representation seats in the [[Chamber of Deputies (Mexico)|Chamber of Deputies]] as a result of obtaining 3.3 percent of the vote. ===2018 Mexican general elections=== {{See also|Juntos Haremos Historia|Opinion polling for the Mexican general election, 2018}} The [[Mexican general election, 2018|2018 Mexican general election]] was the first general election where the PES participated with a candidate aspiring for the [[President of Mexico|presidency]], as the party formed a coalition with left-wing [[National Regeneration Movement]] (MORENA) and [[Labor Party (Mexico)|Labor Party]] (PT). The parties nominated [[Andrés Manuel López Obrador]] as their presidential candidate.https://www.proceso.com.mx/523315/con-referencias-biblicas-amlo-asume-candidatura-del-pes '''Coalition with MORENA''' On 24 June 2017, the PT approved to stand for election in 2018 in an electoral alliance with MORENA; however the coalition was not officially registered before the [[National Electoral Institute]], the electoral authorities of the country. For MORENA, the alliance was facilitated as a result of [[Óscar González Yáñez]], the PT gubernatorial candidate in the State of Mexico, withdrawing from the race and endorsing MORENA candidate [[Delfina Gómez Álvarez]].{{cite news |last=Digital |first=Milenio|title=PT acuerda ir con Morena por la Presidencia en el 2018|url=http://www.milenio.com/politica/pt-morena-elecciones_2018-alianza-presidencia-andres_manuel_lopez_obrador_0_980902074.html|accessdate=5 September 2017|work=Milenio}}{{cite news|title=Aprueba PT coalición con Morena en elecciones de 2018|url=https://www.sdpnoticias.com/nacional/2017/06/25/aprueba-pt-coalicion-con-morena-en-elecciones-de-2018|date=25 June 2017|accessdate=5 September 2017|work=SDPnoticias.com}}{{cite news |url= http://aristeguinoticias.com/2506/mexico/prd-avala-frente-amplio-en-2018-pt-se-va-con-morena-documento/|title=PRD avala “frente amplio” en 2018; PT se va con Morena (Documento)|accessdate=5 September 2017|website=aristeguinoticias.com}} At first, there was speculation about the possibility of a front grouping all the leftist parties: MORENA, PRD, PT and [[Citizens' Movement (Mexico)|Citizens' Movement]] (MC). However, Andrés Manuel López Obrador rejected any kind of agreement due to political differences, especially after the elections in the State of Mexico, when the candidates of the PRD and MC continued with their campaigns refusing to support the candidate of MORENA.{{cite news |url= http://www.animalpolitico.com/2017/06/prd-amlo-alianza-2018/ |title= Prd amlo alianza 2018 |accessdate=5 September 2017 |website= www.animalpolitico.com }} At the end of November 2017, the leaders of MORENA and the PES announced that they were in talks to form a possible alliance. In this sense, Hugo Eric Flores said, "We don't negotiate with the PRI, we have two options, go alone or with MORENA."{{cite news |title =No negociaremos con el PRI; vamos solos o con Morena: PES |url =http://www.excelsior.com.mx/nacional/2017/12/07/1206250 |work =[[Excélsior]] |date =7 December 2017 |accessdate =9 December 2017}} '''Confirmation''' On December 13, the coalition between Morena, the PT and the PES was formalized under the name ''Juntos Haremos Historia'' (English: Together we will make history).{{cite news|title=Partido del Trabajo y Encuentro Social anuncian coalición con Morena|url=http://expansion.mx/politica/2017/12/13/partido-del-trabajo-y-encuentro-social-anuncian-coalicion-con-morena|accessdate=13 December 2017|work=Expansión}} Following the signing of the agreement, Andrés Manuel López Obrador was appointed as a pre-candidate for the three political formations.{{cite news |url= http://www.nacion321.com/elecciones/morena-y-encuentro-social-oficializan-su-union-rumbo-a-2018 |title= Morena y Encuentro Social oficializan su unión rumbo a 2018 |accessdate= 13 December 2017 |author=Nación321 |date= 13 December 2017}} It is a partial coalition that will promote López Obrador as a presidential candidate and, with respect to the legislative elections: MORENA will have to choose candidates in 150 federal electoral districts and 32 districts to the Senate; 75 deputies and 16 senators for PT and 75 deputies and 16 senators for the PES.{{cite news |author =Redacción |title =Morena, PT y Encuentro Social firman coalición rumbo a elección de 2018 |url =http://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/nacional/morena-pt-y-encuentro-social-firman-coalicion-electoral.html |work =El Financiero |date =13 December 2017 |accessdate =13 December 2017}}{{cite news |first =Misael |last =Zavala |title =Firman acuerdo Morena, PES y PT para ir en coalición |url =http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/elecciones-2018/firman-acuerdo-morena-pes-y-pt-para-ir-en-coalicion |work =[[El Universal (México)|El Universal]] |date =13 December 2017 |accessdate =13 December 2017}} The alliance has received criticism as it is a coalition between two leftist parties (MORENA and the PT) with a formation related to the evangelical right (PES).{{cite news |first =Elías |last =Camhaji |title =López Obrador se alía con el conservador Encuentro Social para las elecciones de 2018 |url =https://elpais.com/internacional/2017/12/13/mexico/1513189205_438858.html |work =[[El País]] |date =13 December 2017 |accessdate =13 December 2017}} In response, the national president of MORENA, [[Yeidckol Polevnsky]], mentioned that her party believes in inclusion, joint work to "rescue Mexico" and that they will continue to defend human rights,{{cite news |title =En Morena creemos en la inclusión: Yeidckol ante las críticas por alianza con el PES |url =https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q--bk5vFcQE |work = El Financiero Bloomberg |via=[[Youtube]] |date =13 December 2017 |accessdate =14 December 2017}} while Hugo Eric Flores Cervantes, national president of the PES, mentioned that "the only possibility of real change in our country is the one headed by Andrés Manuel López Obrador" and that his party had decided to be "on the right side of history."{{cite news |title =La única opción para cambiar el país es la que encabeza AMLO: Hugo Eric Flores |url =https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XsTrelNcUQM |work = El Financiero Bloomberg|via=[[Youtube]] |date =13 December 2017 |accessdate =14 December 2017}} '''Results and dissolution''' The results for the ''Juntos Haremos Historia'' coalition were strong; López Obrador was elected president in a landslide victory, as well as winning five of the nine state governorships (one of them for PES candidate [[Cuauhtémoc Blanco]] in [[Morelos]]), and the coalition resulted in the election of 55 federal deputies and 7 senators belonging to the party.{{cite news|url=https://elpais.com/internacional/2018/07/09/mexico/1531161540_362658.html?id_externo_rsoc=TW_AM_CM|work=El País|date=9 July 2018|first=Sonia|last=Corona|accessdate=9 July 2018|title=Los evangélicos se aferran a López Obrador}} However, the party failed to attract three percent of the vote in the elections for president, federal deputies, and senators, which under Mexican law prompts the loss of its federal registry and the appointment of a liquidator by the [[National Electoral Institute|INE]] to dispose of the national party's assets.{{cite news|first=Alejandro|last=Suárez|url=https://www.elsoldemexico.com.mx/mexico/politica/panal-y-pes-pierden-registro-ine-inicia-proceso-de-liquidacion-1825875.html|date=9 July 2018|title=Panal y PES pierden registro; INE inicia proceso de liquidación|work=El Sol de México|accessdate=9 July 2018}} The PES and [[New Alliance Party (Mexico)|New Alliance Party]], the other party to lose its registry after the 2018 elections, challenged the results to no avail and on 3 September 2018, the party was dissolved as it had not reached the 3% of the national vote.{{cite web|title=El Partido Encuentro Social desaparece tras los resultados electorales|url=http://protestantedigital.com/internacional/45438/El_Partido_Encuentro_Social_desaparece_tras_los_resultados_electorales|work=Protestante Digital|date=4 September 2018|accessdate=6 September 2018}}{{cite web|title=INE aprueba pérdida de registro de Nueva Alianza y Encuentro Social|url=https://www.eleconomista.com.mx/politica/INE-aprueba-perdida-de-registro-de-Nueva-Alianza-y-Encuentro-Social-20180903-0027.html|work=El Economista|date=3 September 2018|accessdate=6 September 2018}} ==Policy positions== The PES tends to include many strands of Christian humanist thinking and is generally socially conservative, though Flores has stated that it is a "family" party. {{cite web|URL=http://encuentro.social/cultura-politica-html/|title=Somos el partido de la familia|website=Encuentro Social|access-date=October 28, 2017}} The Baja California state party uses a stylized [[ichthys|ichthus]] in its logo, which is not used by the national organization. The party characterizes itself as the "party of the family". It opposes [[Same-sex marriage in Mexico|same-sex marriage]] and was responsible for reforms to the Baja California constitution in 2008 that established marriage as "between one man and one woman". In 2015, the PES gubernatorial candidate in the state of [[San Luis Potosí]] compared homosexuality to drug trafficking and violence.{{cite news|work=Excélsior|url=http://www.excelsior.com.mx/nacional/2015/03/31/1016283|date=2015-03-31|accessdate=2016-02-14|title=Gays y solteras embarazadas dañan la familia, dice candidato}} Likewise, it opposes abortion and pornographic magazines.{{cite news|work=Milenio|first=Pedro|last=Domínguez|url=http://www.milenio.com/politica/Hugo-Flores-Cervantes-Encuentro-Social_0_242975723.html|date=2014-02-10|accessdate=2016-02-10|title="No somos partido religioso, al contrario, somos liberales": dirigente de Encuentro Social}} Other proposals made by the PES include shifting the collection of [[value-added tax]] to the states instead of the federal government and consolidating it with income tax.{{cite news|work=Vértigo Político|date=2014-11-18|accessdate=2016-01-09|url=http://www.vertigopolitico.com/articulo/27403/Partido-Encuentro-Social-busca-representacion-en-San-Lazaro|first=Arturo|last=Moncada|title=Partido Encuentro Social busca representación en San Lázaro}} ==Electoral history== ===Presidential elections=== {| class="wikitable" ! {{Orphan|date=November 2016}}
'''Stop Bullying: Speak Up''' is a campaign of [[Cartoon Network]] to raise awareness of [[bullying]] issues and promote positive relationships. Cartoon Network’s special programming on bullying issues during the month of October coincides with [[National Bullying Prevention Month]]. The campaign directs witnesses and victims of bullying to "speak up" and enlist the help of a teacher or other responsible adult. The campaign features documentaries, public service ads, and use of existing programs to carry the anti-bullying message on the network, and directs children, parents and educators to other resources about bullying issues, including an anti-bullying pledge.
==History==
Stop Bullying: Speak Up<ref name="LoC">{{cite web|first=Stephanie|last=Chen |url=http://www.cnn.com/2010/LIVING/10/04/bullying.special.explainer/index.html |title=After student's death, a weeklong look into bullying |publisher=CNN.com |date=2010-10-04 |accessdate=2016-11-06}}</ref> was created in 2010 and has partnered with the [[U.S. Department of Health and Human Services]] (Stop Bullying.gov), [[Boys & Girls Clubs of America]], [[Gay, Lesbian and Straight Education Network]] (GLSEN), as well as [[The Anti-Defamation League]] and [[The Southern Poverty Law Center]] through its project, Teaching Tolerance, and other corporate sponsors.
In 2010, the network partnered with [[CNN]] to hold a bullying prevention town hall.
In 2011, the campaign participated in the first Bullying Prevention Summit<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.c-span.org/video/?295021-1/bullying-prevention-summit|title=Bullying Prevention Summit|publisher=}}</ref> at the White House, hosted by President [[Barack Obama]].
In 2012, the Cartoon Network television documentary, Speak Up,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/03/19/obama-denounces-bullying-cartoon-network-documentary_n_1362921.html |title=Obama Denounces Bullying On Cartoon Network Documentary, 'Speak Up' (VIDEO) |publisher=Huffington Post |date=2012-03-19 |accessdate=2016-11-06}}</ref> included an introduction by Obama and featured children and teenagers talking about their experiences of bullying.
In 2013, The Bully Effect,<ref>http://www.bgca.org/newsevents/TheScoop/Pages/CartoonNetworkTheBullyEffect.aspx</ref> a documentary hosted by reporter [[Anderson Cooper]] of CNN in conjunction with Cartoon Network kicked off the campaign to boost bullying awareness.
In 2014, Stop Bullying: Speak Up reached the goal of 1 million people taking the pledge to Speak Up and stop bullying.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/cartoon-network-enlists-one-million-people-to-share-i-speak-up-online-videos-to-kick-off-its-fifth-annual-stop-bullying-speak-up-initiative-273971161.html|title=Cartoon Network Enlists One Million People to Share "I Speak Up" Online Videos to Kick off its Fifth Annual Stop Bullying: Speak Up Initiative|first=Cartoon|last=Network|publisher=}}</ref>
In 2015, Signature CN programs such as ''[[Teen Titans Go! (TV series)|Teen Titans Go!]]'' served as platforms for the anti-bullying message on the network. Families are encouraged to take the pledge. Cartoon Network participated as sponsor of the 2015 International Bullying Prevention Conference<ref>http://www.ibpaworld.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/2015-IBPA-conf-broch.pdf</ref> in Denver, CO.
National Bullying Prevention Month was founded in the United States in 2006 by PACER's National Bullying Prevention Center.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pacer.org/bullying/ |title=PACER's National Bullying Prevention Center |publisher=Pacer.org |date= |accessdate=2016-11-06}}</ref> (PACER is Parents Advocacy Coalition for Educational Rights, based in Minneapolis and Los Angeles.)
==Development==
Stop Bullying: Speak Up was created in response to feedback from the network’s audience of children and youth ages 6–14, which showed that bullying was among the biggest problems faced by young people. Additional research also was conducted among its viewers in 2010 by R. Bradley Snyder, author of The 5 Simple Truths About Raising Kids. Snyder is director of The Dion Initiative for Child Well-Being and Bullying Prevention, in Arizona, which evolved from the work of Stop Bulling Az., founded by Nicole Stanton, wife of Phoenix mayor Greg Stanton.
Other advisors to the Stop Bullying: Speak Up campaign include:
* Joel Haber, Ph.D. Author of ''The Bully Coach'' and nationally recognized speaker on bullying prevention. * Ronald Slaby, Ph.D. Research Associate at Harvard Medical School and Senior Scientist at Education Development Center. * Deborah Temkin, Ph.D. Bullying Prevention Manager for the Speak Truth to Power Program at the Robert F. Kennedy Center for Justice and Human Rights. * David Waren Director of the Anti-Defamation League Education Division, overseeing anti-bias initiatives, Holocaust education programs, programs related to anti-Semitism and campus advocacy.

{{Infobox company | name = Indian Strategic Petroleum Reserve Limited | logo = | type = Storage facilities | industry = [[Petroleum]] | successor = <!-- or: | successors = --> | founded = {{Start date and age|2005}} in [[New Delhi]], [[India]]<ref>http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/energy/oil-gas/india-wants-to-add-uae-saudi-oil-for-strategic-reserve/articleshow/54446688.cms</ref> | hq_location_city = [[Noida]] | hq_location_country = India | area_served = <!-- or: | areas_served = --> | key_people = Rajan K Pillai (CEO) | products = [[Crude Oil]] | owner = [[Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas]] | num_employees = | num_employees_year = <!-- Year of num_employees data (if known) --> | parent = Oil Industry Development Board | website = {{URL|http://www.isprlindia.com}} }}
The '''Indian Strategic Petroleum Reserve''' (ISPR) is an emergency fuel store of total 5.33 MMT (million metric tons) or 36.92 [[Barrel (unit)|MMbbl]] of strategic [[crude oil]] enough to provide 10 days of consumption<ref name="ndtv1"/> which are maintained by the Indian Strategic Petroleum Reserves Limited.<ref name="bs1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/economy-policy/land-acquisition-woes-push-filling-of-strategic-reserves-to-march-115122200213_1.html|title=Filling of strategic oil reserves delayed|accessdate=2015-12-23}}</ref><ref>[http://www.gasandoil.com/goc/news/nts43834.htm Alexander's Gas & Oil Connections - India to build up storage of crude oil] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090418001150/http://www.gasandoil.com/goc/news/nts43834.htm |date=2009-04-18 }}</ref>
Strategic crude oil storages are at three underground locations in [[Mangalore]], [[Visakhapatnam]] and Padur (Udupi, Karnataka). All these are located on the east and west coasts of [[India]] which are readily accessible to the [[List of oil refineries in India|refineries]]. These [[strategic reserve|strategic storages]] are in addition to the existing storages of crude oil and petroleum products with the oil companies and serve in response to external supply disruptions.<ref name="isprl1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.isprlindia.com/aboutus.asp|title=Indian Strategic Petroleum Reserves Limited|accessdate=2016-01-29}}</ref>
==Expansion==
In the 2017-18 budget speech by the Indian finance minister Arun Jaitley, it was announced that two more such caverns will be set up [[Chandikhole]] in Jajpur district of Odisha and [[Bikaner]] in Rajasthan as part of the second phase. This will take the strategic reserve capacity to 15.33 million tons. .<ref name="Economic Times">{{Cite web|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/energy/oil-gas/government-to-build-2-crude-oil-storages-in-odisha-rajasthan/articleshow/56918925.cms|title=Government to build 2 crude oil storages in Odisha, Rajasthan|accessdate=2016-01-02|publisher=Economic Times}}</ref>
Apart from this,India is planning to expand more strategic crude oil facilities in second phase at [[Rajkot]] in Gujarat and Padur in [[Udupi district]] of Karnataka.<ref name="ndtv1">{{Cite web|url=http://profit.ndtv.com/news/industries/article-store-our-oil-and-take-two-thirds-for-free-uaes-offer-to-india-1275964|title=Store Our Oil And Take Two-Thirds For Free: UAE's Offer to India|accessdate=2016-02-10|publisher=NDTV}}</ref>

{{Infobox prison | prison_name = Temara | image = | caption = | location =[[Temara]] | coordinates = {{coord|33|56|4.20|N|6|51|49.98|W|type:landmark_scale:2000|display=title}} | status = Active | capacity = | population = | populationdate = | opened = | closed = | former_name = | managed_by = [[Abdellatif Hamouchi]], Director of the [[Direction générale de la surveillance du territoire|Directorate for the Surveillance of the Territory]] | country =Morocco | prisoners = }} The '''Temara interrogation center''', also known as '''Temara secret detention center''' ({{lang-ar|معتقل تمارة السري}}), is an [[Extrajudicial detention|extrajudicial]] detainment and secret prison facility of [[Morocco]] located within a forested area about 15 kilometres from [[Rabat]], Morocco. It is operated by the [[Direction générale de la surveillance du territoire|Directorate for the Surveillance of the Territory]] (Direction de la surveillance du territoire, DST), a Moroccan domestic intelligence agency implicated in past and ongoing human rights violations,<ref name=amnesty1/> which continues to arrest, detain and interrogate individuals suspected of involvement in terrorism-related activities outside of the Moroccan legal framework.
== History ==
The first known detainee was '''Mohammed Mossadegh Benkhadra''' ({{lang-ar|محمد مصدق بن خضراء}}), in 1985 and spent 8 years in [[Extrajudicial detention|extrajudicial]] detainment and without trial. And later when he was released 1993, he wrote the book "Tazmara 234",<ref name=book/> contraction from words [[Temara]] and [[Tazmamart]] another popular prison and as a sign of continued abuse from the [[Years of Lead (Morocco)]] to present days. More recently, [[Zakaria Moumni]] claimed to have been tortured there when he was arrested in 2010.
== CIA black site == [[File:CIA illegal flights.svg|thumb|upright=2.0|So-called "rendition" illegal flights of the CIA, as reported by ''Rzeczpospolita''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rp.pl/artykul/292283.html |title=Politycy nie pozwolili śledczym tropić lotów CIA – Rzeczpospolita |language=pl |publisher=Rp.pl |date=17 April 2009 |accessdate=17 July 2010}}</ref>]] The [[Associated Press]] reported in August 2010<ref name=associated/> that, according to several current and former American officials, the US government possesses video and audio recordings of [[Ramzi Binalshibh]], an accused plotter of the [[September 11, 2001 attacks]] being interrogated in a secret prison . The US officials told the AP that the prison was run by Moroccans but largely financed by the [[CIA]], which in late 2002 handed Binalshibh over to Moroccan custody and kept him there for five months. The Moroccan government has never acknowledged the facility's existence, despite allegations by freed Guantanamo detainee [[Binyam Mohamed]]<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/0,1518,609464,00.html |date=23 February 2009 |title=Released Guantanamo Detainee: What Did Tony Blair Know? |accessdate=15 April 2012 |publisher=''[[Der Spiegel]]'' |first=Britta |last=Sandberg}}</ref> Temara interrogation centre and others that the CIA relied on Morocco as a secret proxy detention site during the period after September 11, 2001.
==Torture of Detainees== Members of the DST are not considered to be part of the judicial police and as such should not arrest and hold suspects.<ref name=amnesty2/> Frequently reported methods of torture include beatings, the suspension of the body in [[stress positions|contorted positions]], and the threat of [[rape]] or other [[sexual abuse]] of the detainees’ female relatives. Other reported methods include rape by the forced insertion of objects such as bottles into the [[human anus|anus]], [[sleep deprivation]], [[cigarette]] burns, and the [[electric shock torture|application of live electrodes to the body]]. Several [[non-government organizations]] such as [[Amnesty International]] and [[Human Rights Watch]] have denounced reports of torture at the facility.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.middle-east-online.com/english/?id=46151 |title=Moroccan MPs back probe into detention centre |publisher=Middle East Online |date=16 May 2011 |accessdate=15 April 2012}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|refs= <ref name=amnesty1>{{cite news |title=Document - Morocco: Continuing abuses against individuals suspected of terrorism-related activities in Morocco |url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/mde29/013/2010/en/ |date=16 June 2010 |df= }}</ref> <ref name=amnesty2>{{cite news |title=Morocco/Western Sahara: Torture in the "anti-terrorism" campaign - the case of Témara detention centre |url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/mde29/013/2010/en/ |date=16 June 2010 |df= }}</ref> <ref name=book>{{cite news |title=Tazmara 234 محمد مصدق بن خضراء |url=http://lib3m.com/ar/product_info.php/products_id/1583/language/ar }}</ref> <ref name=associated>{{cite news |title=Matt Apuzzo and Adam Goldman, "To keep program secret, CIA whisked 9/11 figures from Gitmo before court ruling," Associated Press, August 6, 2010.}}</ref> }}

page.title: Temporary Committee on the alleged use of European countries by the CIA for the transport and illegal detention of prisoners

revision.text:
The '''Temporary Committee on the alleged use of European countries by the CIA for the transport and illegal detention of prisoners''', widely referred to as the '''CIA committee''', was a [[Committees of the European Parliament|Committee of the European Parliament]] that was set up in 2006 to investigate the alleged role of the U.S. [[Central Intelligence Agency]] in the [[extraordinary rendition]] of terrorists. The chairman of the committee was [[Carlos Coelho]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Carlos COELHO|url=http://www.europarl.europa.eu/meps/en/1892/CARLOS_COELHO_history.html|publisher=[[European Parliament]]|accessdate=28 January 2014}}</ref>
== Final report == An interim report was released in 2006, which stated that "the CIA or other US services have been directly responsible for the illegal seizure, removal, abduction and detention of terrorist suspects on the territory of member states".<ref>{{cite web|title=EU backs report on CIA kidnappings|url=http://tvnz.co.nz/content/748517/425822.xhtml|publisher=[[Television New Zealand]]|accessdate=28 January 2014|date=13 June 2006}}</ref>
The Chairman of the committee, [[Carlos Coelho]], claimed that the CIA's [[extraordinary rendition]]s in Europe was carried out "with the knowledge and support of European national governments".<ref>{{cite web|title=MEPs say intelligence sources reveal 30 to 50 extraordinary renditions have taken place|url=http://www.europarl.europa.eu/sides/getDoc.do?type=IM-PRESS&reference=20060515IPR08166&format=XML&language=EN|publisher=[[European Parliament]]|accessdate=28 January 2014}}</ref>
In 2007, the final report of the committee was released, which revealed the existence of secret detention facilities in Europe. According to the report, over one thousand CIA-operated flights used European airspace from 2001 to 2005.<ref name="a1">{{cite web|title=CIA activities in Europe: European Parliament adopts final report deploring passivity from some Member States|url=http://www.europarl.europa.eu/sides/getDoc.do?language=EN&type=IM-PRESS&reference=20070209IPR02947|publisher=[[European Parliament]]|accessdate=28 January 2014}}</ref>
The report also included the following details:
* Officials of the Italian military security services ([[SISMI]]) played an "active role" in the abduction of [[Abu Omar case|Abu Omar]] in the Italian capital [[Milan]]. In addition, the director of the SISMI had "concealed the truth" when he denied the SISMI's involvement.<ref name="a1"/> * The [[Republic of Macedonia]] failed to thoroughly investigate the abduction of [[Khalid El-Masri]].<ref name="a1"/> * The Polish government failed to cooperate with the committee in its investigations.<ref name="a1"/> * The German Government refused to allow the United States to release rendition victim [[Murat Kurnaz]], who was interrogated twice by German officials, from the [[Guantanamo Bay detention camp]].<ref name="a1"/>
== Reception ==
The committee's final report was approved by the European Parliament with 382 votes in favour, 256 against, and 74 abstentions.<ref name="a1"/>
== See also ==
* [[Temporary Committee on the ECHELON Interception System]]

{{merge from|Smurfette principle|discuss=Talk:Tokenism#Proposed merge with Smurfette principle|date=March 2018}} {{refimprove|date=April 2016}} '''Tokenism''' is the practice of making only a perfunctory or symbolic effort to be [[Inclusion (value and practice)|inclusive]] to members of [[minority group]]s, especially by recruiting a small number of people from underrepresented groups in order to give the appearance of [[Racial equality|racial]] or [[sexual equality]] within a workforce.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/us/definition/american_english/tokenism|title=tokenism: definition of tokenism in Oxford dictionary|work=Oxford Dictionaries Online}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oed.com/view/Entry/202951?redirectedFrom=tokenism#eid|title=tokenism, n.|work=[[Oxford English Dictionary]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/tokenism|title=Tokenism|work=[[Reference.com]]}}</ref> The effort of including a token employee to a workforce is usually intended to create the impression of social inclusiveness and [[Diversity (politics)|diversity]] (racial, religious, sexual, etc.) in order to deflect accusations of [[discrimination]].<ref name="hogg&vaughan">{{cite book|last1=Hogg|first1=Michael A.|last2=Vaughan|first2=Graham M.|title=Social Psychology|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=7MtEr4r2pRcC&pg=PA368|year=2008|publisher=[[Prentice Hall]]|location=Harlow|pages=368–369|isbn=978-0-13-206931-1}}</ref> One additionally relevant term for tokenism is "hyper-tokenism". Hyper-tokenism is where a person of color has increased screen time, is involved in the plot and in promotional images, but the white characters are still the most significant characters by the end of the film.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nalip.org/5_ways_movies_fake_racial_diversity|title=5 Ways Movies Fake Racial Diversity|work=NALIP|access-date=2018-11-26}}</ref> Another relevant term is "ambiguously brown". Ambiguously brown characters are characters that are white-passing, but not fully white so that whatever they are cast in is not completely whitewashed. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://rampages.us/hypermasculinityinfilms/racial-tropes-and-tokenism/|title=Racial Tropes and Tokenism {{!}} Hypermasculinity and Racism in Film|website=rampages.us|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-26}}</ref> ==History== The social concept and the employment practice of ''tokenism'' became understood in the [[popular culture]] of the United States in the late 1950s.{{Citation needed|date=April 2016}}. In the face of [[Racial segregation in the United States|racial segregation]], tokenism emerged as a solution that though earnest in effort, only acknowledged an issue without actually solving it.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://whowhatwhy.org/2014/05/12/the-plague-of-tokenism/|title=The Plague of Tokenism|last=Wallis|first=Victor|date=|website=|access-date=August 6, 2017}}</ref> In the book ''[[Why We Can't Wait]]'' (1964), [[civil rights]] activist [[Martin Luther King Jr.]] discussed the subject of tokenism, and how it constitutes a minimal acceptance of [[black people]] to the [[mainstream]] of U.S. society.<ref>{{cite book|last=King|first=Martin Luther|year=1964|title=[[Why We Can't Wait]]|publisher=Harper & Row|isbn=978-0451527530}}</ref>
When asked about the gains of the [[African-American civil rights movement (1954–1968)|Civil Rights Movement]] in 1963, [[human rights]] activist [[Malcolm X]] answered, “What gains? All you have gotten is tokenism — one or two [[Negro]]es in a job, or at a lunch counter, so the rest of you will be quiet.”<ref>{{cite web|url=http://teachingamericanhistory.org/library/document/a-summing-up-louis-lomax-interviews-malcolm-x/|title=A Summing Up: Louis Lomax interviews Malcolm X|website=Teaching American History|first=Louis|last=Lomax|date=1963|accessdate=September 4, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|last=Frost|first=Bryan-Paul|last2=Sikkenga|first2=Jeffrey|page=689|year=2003|title=History of American Political Thought|publisher=Lexington Books|isbn=978-0739106242}}</ref>
In the field of [[psychology]], the broader definition of tokenism is a situation in which a member of a distinctive category is treated differently from other people. The characteristics that make the person of interest a token can be perceived as either a handicap or an advantage, as supported by Václav Linkov. In a positive light, these distinct people can be seen as experts in their racial/cultural category, valued skills, or a different perspective on a project. In contrast, tokenism is most often seen as a handicap due to the [[ostracism]] of a selected sample of a minority group.<ref name=":0">Linkov, Václav. "Tokenism In Psychology: Standing On The Shoulders Of Small Boys." ''Integrative Psychological & Behavioral Science'' 48.2 (2014): 143-160. ''Academic Search Complete''. Web. 10 Mar. 2016.</ref> Linkov also attributes drawbacks in psychology to Cultural and Numerical Tokenism, instances that have shifted where value of expertise is placed and its effect on proliferating information that is not representative of all the possible facts.<ref name=":0" />
Black characters being the first characters to die was first identified in Hollywood horror movies of the 1930s, notes writer Renee Cozier. More recently, not a single actor of color was nominated for the 2015 or 2016 Oscars. Around this time, minorities accounted for 12.9% of lead roles in 163 films surveyed in 2014, according to the 2016 Hollywood Diversity Report.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://newsroom.ucla.edu/releases/hollywood-diversity-report:-mounting-evidence-that-more-diverse-casts-help-the-bottom-line|title=Hollywood Diversity Report: Mounting evidence that more diverse casts help the bottom line|last=Greene|first=Eric|website=UCLA Newsroom|language=en|access-date=2018-11-26}}</ref>
===In television=== Tokenism, in a television setting, can be any act of putting a minority into the mix to create some sort of publicly viewed diversity. A racial divide in TV has been present since the first television show that hired minorities, ''[[Amos 'n' Andy]]'' (1928-1960) in 1943. Regardless of whether a token character may be stereotypical or not, tokenism can initiate a whole biased perceived sense of thought that may conflict with how people see a specific race, culture, gender, or ethnicity.<ref>{{cite journal|url=https://dx.doi.org/10.1207/s15506878jobem4404_11|title=A New Piece to the Puzzle: Examining Effects of Television Portrayals of African Americans|first=James A.|last=Rada|date=1 December 2000|publisher=|volume=44|issue=4|pages=704–715|accessdate=23 January 2017|via=Taylor and Francis+NEJM|doi=10.1207/s15506878jobem4404_11}}</ref> From the [[HuffPost|Huffington Post]], [[America Ferrera]] states, “Tokenism is about inserting diverse characters because you feel you have to; true diversity means writing characters that aren’t just defined by the color of their skin, and casting the right actor for the role." <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/america-ferrera-breaks-down-the-difference-between-tokenism-and-true-diversity_us_573f1a92e4b045cc9a70b132|title=America Ferrera Breaks Down The Difference Between Tokenism And 'True Diversity'|first1=Carolina Moreno|last1=Editor|first2=The Huffington|last2=Post|date=20 May 2016|publisher=|accessdate=23 January 2017}}</ref>
Tokenism in television has been spoken about under a different umbrella in recent decades. For example, tokenism was analyzed in an article that examined actions in the television show ''[[Scandal (TV series)|Scandal]]'' (2012-). Though today there are many black main characters in many popular television shows, Stephanie L. Gomez's article speaks about [[Kerry Washington]] as [[Olivia Pope]]. Gomez compares the character of Olivia Pope to three [[Trope (literature)|tropes]] of Black women, The slave mistress, The help, and [[Stereotypes_of_African_Americans#Jezebel| The Jezebel]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Gomez|first=Stephanie L.|last2=McFarlane|first2=Megan D.|date=2017-05-04|title="It’s (not) handled": race, gender, and refraction in Scandal|url=https://dx.doi.org/10.1080/14680777.2016.1218352|journal=Feminist Media Studies|volume=17|issue=3|pages=362–376|doi=10.1080/14680777.2016.1218352|issn=1468-0777}}</ref>
In the early 1990s, shows like ''[[The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air]]'' (1990-1996) and ''[[Martin (TV series)|Martin]]'' (1992-1997), were strategies that were used to capitalize from an underrepresented group, namely the black community in television at the time. Networks allowed the shows to be black-produced and have all-black casts. This strategy was used because at the time the black viewership did not have many shows made specifically for them, and networks used this tactic to capitalize on them. Networks knew that many black people would purchase televisions and cable subscriptions if there were more people like them on the television, this is also conveyed tokenism.{{Citation needed|reason=Your The entire section lacks sources. Umvlear if these sitcoms were marketed towards black audiences. |date=January 2018}}
The CW show ''[[The 100 (TV series)|The 100]]'', though it has a lot of minorities cast, still displays ample tokenism with how these characters are used in the show. Lincoln plays the "scary black man" trope before he is more humanized by his white love interest and then ultimately killed off. Raven Reyes is hypersexualized or tortured during her screen time. Wells Jaha is killed off in season one. On top of this, the only LGBT representation the show includes is when character Clarke and Lexa become an item, but Lexa is soon killed off for shock value.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://affinitymagazine.us/2017/02/10/when-representation-becomes-tokenism-why-we-need-diverse-creators/|title=When Representation Becomes Tokenism: Why We Need Diverse Creators|date=2017-02-10|work=Affinity Magazine|access-date=2018-11-26|language=en-US}}</ref>
Another show with tokenism is the CW show ''[[Riverdale (2017 TV series)|Riverdale]]''. In this teen drama, [[Kevin Keller (comics)|Kevin Keller]] is the only gay character in the ensemble cast. He has very little significance to the actual plot and has way less screen time than other characters. When he is on screen, he plays a stereotyped flamboyant gay teen.{{Citation needed|reason=The entire paragraph has no sources.|date=November 2018}}
In 2012, Acura put out a casting call for their commercial where they stated that the main actor must be a “nice looking, friendly, not too dark” African American.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theroot.com/acura-casting-call-not-too-dark-blacks-1790891043|title=Acura Casting Call: 'Not Too Dark' Blacks|last=Staff|first=The Root|work=The Root|access-date=2018-11-23|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.tmz.com/2012/04/18/acura-nsx-super-bowl-commercial-seinfeld-light-skinned-black-casting/|title=Acura NSX Super Bowl Commercial -- Only Light-Skinned Blacks Need Apply|work=TMZ|access-date=2018-11-23}}</ref>
=== In the media === Just like television, Tokenism in the media has changed over time to coincide with real life events. During the years of 1946-87 the weekly magazine, The ''[[New Yorker (magazine)|New Yorker]]'' was analyzed to determine how often and in what situations blacks were being portrayed in the magazine's cartoon section. Over the 42 years of research, there was only one U.S. black main character in a cartoon where race was not the main theme, race was actually completely irrelevant. All cartoons from the earliest times depicted U.S. blacks in stereotypical roles. In the late 1960s and early 1970s cartoons were mostly racial themed, and depicted blacks in "token" roles where they are only there to create a sense of inclusiveness.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Thibodeau|first=Ruth|date=1989-01-01|title=From Racism to Tokenism: The Changing Face of Blacks in New Yorker Cartoons|url=https://doi.org/10.1086/269168|journal=Public Opinion Quarterly|language=en|volume=53|issue=4|doi=10.1086/269168|issn=0033-362X}}</ref>
=== In the workplace === A [[Harvard Business School]] professor, [[Rosabeth Moss Kanter]], asserted back in 1993 that a token employee is usually part of a "socially-skewed group" of employees who belong to a [[minority group]] that constitutes less than 15% of the total employee population of the workplace. {{sfn|Kanter|1993|}}
By definition, token employees in a workplace are known to be few; hence, their alleged high visibility among the staff subjects them to greater pressure to perform their work at higher production standards of quality and volume and to behave in the expected, stereotypical manner. {{sfn|Kanter|1993|}} Given the smallness of the group of token employees in a workplace, the individual identity of each token person is usually disrespected by the dominant group, who apply a stereotype role to them as a means of social control in the workplace. {{sfn|Kanter|1993|}}
Research comparing the effects of gender and race tokenism on individuals indicates that the practice of tokenism can accurately predict conditions in the workplace for members of racial minorities.<ref name="jackson et al.">{{cite journal |last1= Jackson |first1= Pamela Braboy |last2= Thoits |first2= Peggy A. |last3 = Taylor | first3 = Howard F. |year= 1995 |title= Composition of the Workplace and Psychological Well-Being: The Effects of Tokenism on America's Black Elite |journal= Social Forces |volume= 74 |issue= 2 |pages= 543–557 |publisher= |doi= 10.1093/sf/74.2.543 |url= |accessdate= }}</ref>
According to one study, racial minorities also experience heightened performance pressures related to their race and gender; however, many reported that racial problems were more common than gender problems.<ref name="turner">{{cite journal |last1= Turner |first1= Caroline Sotello Viernes |last2= |first2=|last3 = | first3 = |year= 2002 |title= Women of Color in Academe: Living with Multiple Marginality |journal= [[The Journal of Higher Education]] |volume= 73 |issue= 1 |pages= 74–93 |publisher= |doi= 10.2307/1558448 |url= |accessdate= }}</ref>
In her work on tokenism and gender, professor Kanter said that the problems experienced by women in a typically male-dominated occupations were due solely to the skewed proportions of men and women in these occupations. {{sfn|Kanter |1993}}
===In politics=== In politics, allegations of tokenism may occur when a [[political party]] puts forward candidates from under-represented groups, such as women or racial minorities, in races that the party has little or no chance of winning, while making limited or no effort to ensure that such candidates have similar opportunity to win the nomination in races where the party is safe or favoured.<ref>{{cite news|last=Duffy |first=Andrew |title=More women, fewer chances |date=9 April 2011 |page=B3 |url=https://www.pressreader.com/canada/ottawa-citizen/20110409/298186695737023 |accessdate=16 July 2018}}{{Failed verification|date=July 2018}}.</ref> The "token" candidates are frequently submitted as [[paper candidate|paper candidates]], in which a person is placed on the ballot solely to make sure the political party has a candidate in the race even if that candidate has almost no chance of actually winning, while the more competitive nature of the candidate selection process in winnable seats continues to favour members of the majority group.<ref name=paradox/>
The end result of such an approach is that the party's slate of candidates maintains the appearance of [[diversity (politics)|diversity]], but members of the majority group remain overrepresented in the party's [[caucus]] after the election — and thus little to no substantive progress toward greater inclusion of underrepresented groups has actually occurred.<ref name=paradox>{{cite book|last=Kanthak|first=Kristin|last2=Krause|first2=George A.|year=2012|title=The Diversity Paradox: Political Parties, Legislatures, and the Organizational Foundations of Representation in America|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=978-0199891740}}</ref>
The New York Times dives into address tokenism in politics by mentioning Nikki Haley. Haley is first generation American, having Indian immigrants as parents. Despite the fact that she has little experience with foreign policy, President Trump chose her as the current United States Ambassador to the United Nations.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/01/10/magazine/i-know-how-it-feels-to-be-someones-token-im-sure-ben-carson-does-too.html|title=I Know How It Feels to Be Someone’s ‘Token.’ I’m Sure Ben Carson Does, Too.|access-date=2018-11-23|language=en}}</ref>
==In fiction== {{See also|Magical Negro|Stereotype#Role in art and culture}} In fiction, a token character exists only to achieve minimal compliance with the normality presumed for the society described in the story. Writers also use the token character to pay lip service to the rules and the standards that they do not abide, such as by obeying anti-[[racism]] policies, by including a token ethnic-minority character who has no true, narrative function in the [[Plot (narrative)|plot]] and is usually a [[stereotype]] character.
In fiction, token characters represent groups which vary from the norm (usually defined as a white, heterosexual male) and are otherwise excluded from the story. The token character can be based on [[ethnic group|ethnicity]] (i.e. [[Black people|black]], [[Hispanic]], [[Asian people|Asian]]), [[religion]] (i.e. [[Jew]]ish, [[Muslim]]), sexual orientation (i.e. [[homosexuality|homosexual]]), or gender (typically a [[female]] character in a predominantly male cast). Token characters are usually background characters, and, as such, are usually disposable, and are eliminated from the narrative early in the story, in order to enhance the drama, while conserving the main characters.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/media/ethnic-minorities-accuse-tv-programmers-of-tokenism-869817.html | work=The Independent | location=London | title=Ethnic minorities accuse TV programmers of tokenism | first=Sadie | last=Gray | date=2008-07-17 | accessdate=2010-03-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2002/nov/12/radio.raceintheuk | work=The Guardian | location=London | title=Minorities accuse TV and radio of tokenism | first=Helen | last=Carter | date=2002-11-13 | accessdate=2010-03-27}}</ref>
In much contemporary cinema and television, the inclusion of token characters is usually and implausibly seen in historical settings where such a person's race would be immediately noticed.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2011/dec/08/wuthering-heights-film-tackles-racism-full-on?CMP=twt_fd |title=Response The new Wuthering Heights does not ignore racism; it tackles it full on | Comment is free |publisher=The Guardian |date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2012-02-13}}</ref> Typically, other characters tend to treat the token characters as though they are not concerned with their race or ethnicity. Notable exceptions to this practice include stories based in history and stories that address racism directly.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2011/nov/11/wuthering-heights-black-actors |title=Why Wuthering Heights gives me hope|publisher=The Guardian |date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2012-02-13}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Philip |last=French |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2011/nov/13/wuthering-heights-andrea-arnold-review |title=Wuthering Heights – review | Film | The Observer |publisher=Guardian |date=2011-11-13 |accessdate=2012-02-13}}</ref> The ''[[South Park]]'' character [[Token Black]] is a reference to this.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.southparkstudios.com/guide/characters/token-black | title=South Park Studios | accessdate=January 27, 2013}}</ref>
British films and TV programmes might include a token American character, sometimes in situations where the presence of an American would have been unlikely, in order to appeal to viewers in the U.S., e.g. the character "Agar" in ''[[The First Great Train Robbery]]'' (1979), and character of "Flt. Lt. Carrington" in the first series of ''[[Colditz (TV series)|Colditz]]'' (1972), about British prisoners of war, during the Second World War (1939–45).
